trans-unit.source: 10GB GraySort Hadoop MapReduce sample | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: 10GB GraySort Hadoop MapReduce sample | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to run a general purpose GraySort for very large amounts of data, usually a 100 TB minimum, on Hadoop with HDInsight using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to run a general purpose GraySort for very large amounts of data, usually a 100 TB minimum, on Hadoop with HDInsight using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The 10GB GraySort Hadoop MapReduce sample in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: The 10GB GraySort Hadoop MapReduce sample in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This sample topic shows how to run a general-purpose GraySort Hadoop MapReduce program on Azure HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This sample topic shows how to run a general-purpose GraySort Hadoop MapReduce program on Azure HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: GraySort is a benchmark sort whose metric is the sort rate (TB/minute) that is achieved while sorting very large amounts of data, usually a 100TB minimum.
trans-unit.target: GraySort is a benchmark sort whose metric is the sort rate (TB/minute) that is achieved while sorting very large amounts of data, usually a 100TB minimum.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on running this and other samples with Linux-based clusters, see [Run the Hadoop samples in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-run-samples-linux.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on running this and other samples with Linux-based clusters, see [Run the Hadoop samples in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-run-samples-linux.md)

trans-unit.source: This sample uses a modest 10GB of data so that it can be run relatively quickly.
trans-unit.target: This sample uses a modest 10GB of data so that it can be run relatively quickly.

trans-unit.source: It uses the MapReduce applications developed by Owen O'Malley and Arun Murthy that won the annual general-purpose ("daytona") terabyte sort benchmark in 2009 with a rate of 0.578TB/min (100TB in 173 minutes).
trans-unit.target: It uses the MapReduce applications developed by Owen O'Malley and Arun Murthy that won the annual general-purpose ("daytona") terabyte sort benchmark in 2009 with a rate of 0.578TB/min (100TB in 173 minutes).

trans-unit.source: For more information on this and other sorting benchmarks, see the [Sortbenchmark](http://sortbenchmark.org/) site.
trans-unit.target: For more information on this and other sorting benchmarks, see the [Sortbenchmark](http://sortbenchmark.org/) site.

trans-unit.source: This sample uses three sets of MapReduce programs:
trans-unit.target: This sample uses three sets of MapReduce programs:

trans-unit.source: **TeraGen** is a MapReduce program that you can use to generate the rows of data to sort.
trans-unit.target: **TeraGen** is a MapReduce program that you can use to generate the rows of data to sort.

trans-unit.source: **TeraSort** samples the input data and uses MapReduce to sort the data into a total order.
trans-unit.target: **TeraSort** samples the input data and uses MapReduce to sort the data into a total order.

trans-unit.source: TeraSort is a standard sort of MapReduce functions, except for a custom partitioner that uses a sorted list of N-1 sampled keys that define the key range for each reduce.
trans-unit.target: TeraSort is a standard sort of MapReduce functions, except for a custom partitioner that uses a sorted list of N-1 sampled keys that define the key range for each reduce.

trans-unit.source: In particular, all keys such that sample[i-1] <= key < sample[i] are sent to reduce i.
trans-unit.target: In particular, all keys such that sample[i-1] <= key < sample[i] are sent to reduce i.

trans-unit.source: This guarantees that the outputs of reduce i are all less than the output of reduce i+1.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees that the outputs of reduce i are all less than the output of reduce i+1.

trans-unit.source: **TeraValidate** is a MapReduce program that validates that the output is globally sorted.
trans-unit.target: **TeraValidate** is a MapReduce program that validates that the output is globally sorted.

trans-unit.source: It creates one map per file in the output directory, and each map ensures that each key is less than or equal to the previous one.
trans-unit.target: It creates one map per file in the output directory, and each map ensures that each key is less than or equal to the previous one.

trans-unit.source: The map function also generates records of the first and last keys of each file, and the reduce function ensures that the first key of file i is greater than the last key of file i-1.
trans-unit.target: The map function also generates records of the first and last keys of each file, and the reduce function ensures that the first key of file i is greater than the last key of file i-1.

trans-unit.source: Any problems are reported as an output of the reduce with the keys that are out of order.
trans-unit.target: Any problems are reported as an output of the reduce with the keys that are out of order.

trans-unit.source: The input and output format, used by all three applications, reads and writes the text files in the right format.
trans-unit.target: The input and output format, used by all three applications, reads and writes the text files in the right format.

trans-unit.source: The output of the reduce has replication set to 1, instead of the default 3, because the benchmark contest does not require that the output data be replicated on to multiple nodes.
trans-unit.target: The output of the reduce has replication set to 1, instead of the default 3, because the benchmark contest does not require that the output data be replicated on to multiple nodes.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure PowerShell to run a series of MapReduce programs on Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure PowerShell to run a series of MapReduce programs on Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: What a MapReduce program written in Java looks like.
trans-unit.target: What a MapReduce program written in Java looks like.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **an HDInsight cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **an HDInsight cluster**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see [Provision HDInsight Clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see [Provision HDInsight Clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: Run the sample with Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Run the sample with Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Three tasks are required by the sample, each corresponding to one of the MapReduce programs described in the introduction:
trans-unit.target: Three tasks are required by the sample, each corresponding to one of the MapReduce programs described in the introduction:

trans-unit.source: Generate the data for sorting by running the **TeraGen** MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Generate the data for sorting by running the **TeraGen** MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Sort the data by running the **TeraSort** MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Sort the data by running the **TeraSort** MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the data has been correctly sorted by running the **TeraValidate** MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the data has been correctly sorted by running the **TeraValidate** MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: To run the TeraGen program
trans-unit.target: To run the TeraGen program

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on opening the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell] [powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For instructions on opening the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell] [powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:
trans-unit.target: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create a MapReduce job definition:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create a MapReduce job definition:

trans-unit.source: The *"-Dmapred.map.tasks=50"* argument specifies that 50 maps will be created to execute the job.
trans-unit.target: The *"-Dmapred.map.tasks=50"* argument specifies that 50 maps will be created to execute the job.

trans-unit.source: The *100000000* argument specifies the amount of data to generate.
trans-unit.target: The *100000000* argument specifies the amount of data to generate.

trans-unit.source: The final argument, */example/data/10GB-sort-input*, specifies the output directory to which the results are saved (and which contains the input for the following sort stage).
trans-unit.target: The final argument, */example/data/10GB-sort-input*, specifies the output directory to which the results are saved (and which contains the input for the following sort stage).

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to submit the job, wait for the job to finish, and then print the standard error:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to submit the job, wait for the job to finish, and then print the standard error:

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This sample has demonstrated how to run a series of MapReduce jobs by using Azure HDInsight, where the data output for one job becomes the input for the next job in the series.
trans-unit.target: This sample has demonstrated how to run a series of MapReduce jobs by using Azure HDInsight, where the data output for one job becomes the input for the next job in the series.
